data.title: A Legacy of Excellence. A Vision for the Future.
data.intro: The Datta Meghe Institute of Higher Education and Research (DMIHER), formerly Datta Meghe Institute of Medical Sciences (DMIMS), is an institution on a dynamic growth path. Recognized as a Deemed University by the University Grants Commission (UGC) in 2005, DMIHER has expanded beyond its foundational roots in medical education, emerging as a thriving center for multidisciplinary learning.

pillars.title: Integrated
pillars.desc: Sharing, Nesting, Co-relation, Integrated, Museum SISA, IDCD

vision.title: Vision
vision.content_mobile: To emerge as the global centre of excellence in the best evidence based higher education encompassing a quality centric, innovative and interdisciplinary approach, generating refutative research and offering effective and affordable health care for the benefit of mankind
content_desktop: To emerge as the global centre of
excellence in the best evidence based
and offering effective and affordable health
care for the benefit of the mankind

mission.title: Mission
points: DMIHER shall develop competent, confident, concerned, compassionate and globally relevant professionals by quality, learner, community and evidence centric ‘competency-based model’ of higher education with a value orientation, through all its constituent units.
It shall foster a conducive milieu for interdisciplinary research practices generating consequential and meaningful outcomes for the nation in general and the region in particular.
It shall deliver comprehensive quality health care services to the rural, needy, marginalized and underprivileged populace.
This shall be achieved through appropriate collaborative linkages and a proactive, transparent and accountable decentralized governance system.

values.title: Purpose-Driven Excellence
values.description: We pursue excellence with clarity of purpose—grounded in evidence, inspired by impact.

values.title: Compassion with Competence
values.description: We nurture professionals who blend knowledge with empathy, serving humanity with heart and skill.

values.title: Integrity in Innovation
values.description: We lead with curiosity and act with conscience—ensuring our innovations uphold ethics and elevate society.

values.title: Collaboration for Impact
values.description: We break silos and build bridges—across disciplines, communities, and borders—to multiply our contribution.

values.title: Equity in Access and Action
values.description: We believe progress must be inclusive. From rural healthcare to global research, we act where we are needed most.

data.tagline: A Learning Ecosystem That Shapes Who You Become
intro_paragraphs: At DMIHER, you step into an open, future-facing academic environment— designed to nurture curiosity, deepen understanding, and build real-world capabilities. With a blend of integrated thinking, value-led perspectives, hands-on methods, and global digital tools, your learning experience goes beyond classrooms. You don’t just earn a degree—you grow into a confident, competent professional, ready to thrive in a world that’s constantly evolving.

slides.title: ADVANCING ACADEMIC QUALITY
slides.paragraph: Internal Quality Assurance Cell — Elevating Standards, Sustaining Excellence

data.tagline: Nurturing a culture of continuous improvement
intro_paragraphs: In alignment with the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC - Bangalore) guidelines for every accredited institution, the Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC) at DMIHER (DU) embodies the institution’s commitment to quality sustenance and enhancement. Embedded at the core of the university’s future vision, IQAC leads the foundational steps toward internalizing and institutionalizing quality enhancement initiatives. With a focus on systematic, catalytic progress, the IQAC integrates quality benchmarks, disseminates best practices, and fosters a culture of continuous learning and institutional excellence.

Structured into four key functional units-Rankings and Accreditations, Quality benchmarks & Best Practices; Audits , Feedbacks & Evaluation; Quality dissemination and Quality circles-the IQAC stands as a cornerstone of DMIHER (DU)’s academic ecosystem, driving quality-driven growth and global recognition.

data.heading: Our Functional Units
data.description: Aligned with the functions outlined by the National Assessment & Accreditation Council (NAAC) in December 2017, the Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC) at DMIHER (DU) is structured into four functional units (wings), each driving transformative impact and steering the institution towards continuous, progressive excellence.

units.title: Rankings and Accreditations
points: Strategize Institutional growth in National and International level through planning and participating in various Accreditations and Rankings
Coordinate the preparation of the Annual Quality Assurance Report (AQAR)

units.title: Quality benchmarks & Best Practices
points: Identify emerging areas in Higher Education and Quality benchmarks thereof.
Ensure application of quality benchmarks in all academic and administrative functions
Document, Analyse and Recommend strategies leading to quality improvement
Ensure adoption and dissemination of best practices
Promote use of technology in various functions and processes of the University
Act as a catalyst in Internalisation of Quality culture

units.title: Audits, Feedbacks & Evaluation
points: Encourage self and external evaluation, accountability, autonomy and innovations
Ensure periodical Academic and Administrative Audits
Collect and analyse stakeholder feedback

units.title: Quality dissemination and Quality circles
points: Organize quality related workshops and seminars
Mentor other HEIs through quality initiatives
Ensure adoption and dissemination of best practices

data.tagline: CONNECTING STUDENTS, FACULTY, AND INSTITUTIONS ACROSS CONTINENTS
intro_paragraphs: Fostering innovation, collaboration, and shared growth.From immersive global programs and high-impact research to alumni shaping industries worldwide, DMIHER’s global footprint empowers learners and educators to drive change both within and beyond our borders. Our international centers, faculty exchange, student mobility, and collaborations with top-ranked institutions create a dynamic environment where knowledge knows no bounds.

data.heading: GLOBAL ALLIANCES, UNBOUNDED POSSIBILITIES
data.description: Our network of global partnerships connects DMIHER with leading institutions and organizations worldwide, fostering innovation, knowledge exchange, and transformative collaborations. These relationships empower students, faculty, and researchers to drive positive change on a global scale.

data.title: Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College
data.tagline: A Learning Ecosystem That Shapes Who You Become
intro_paragraphs: Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College (JNMC) is a premier medical education institution in India, offering MBBS, PG, and Super Speciality programs. Established in 2007, JNMC is committed to providing quality education and training to students in the field of medicine. The college is located in the heart of the city of Indore, Madhya Pradesh, India. The college is affiliated with the University of Rajasthan, Jaipur, and is accredited by the Medical Council of India (MCI). The college is also accredited by the National Accreditation Board for Higher Education (NABHE) and the Commission on Accreditation of Medical Education Programs (COAMED).

JNMC offers a wide range of programs, including MBBS, PG, and Super Speciality programs. The college is also accredited by the National Accreditation Board for Higher Education (NABHE) and the Commission on Accreditation of Medical Education Programs (COAMED).
more_paragraphs: JNMC is committed to providing quality education and training to students in the field of medicine. The college is located in the heart of the city of Indore, Madhya Pradesh, India. The college is affiliated with the University of Rajasthan, Jaipur, and is accredited by the Medical Council of India (MCI). The college is also accredited by the National Accreditation Board for Higher Education (NABHE) and the Commission on Accreditation of Medical Education Programs (COAMED).

data.heading: DEAN’S MESSAGE
paragraphs: Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College & Acharya Vinoba Bhave Rural Hospital, established in 1990 under the Datta Meghe Institute of Higher Education and Research (Deemed to be University), Wardha, stands as a premier institution for medical education, research, and healthcare services. Ranked 23rd nationally, we offer MBBS (250 seats), postgraduate, super-specialty, paramedical, and PhD programs, all accredited with NAAC ‘A++’.

Our innovations include ‘Anukruti’, a state-of-the-art Simulation Centre, ‘Jigyasa’, a central integrated museum, and early adoption of NEP 2020. As a nodal centre for faculty development, we integrate cutting-edge teaching methodologies and host national and international conferences. Through robust community partnerships, we adopt villages to extend healthcare services.

We are home to the region’s largest tertiary care hospital, a Super-specialty centre, and a dedicated Cancer hospital, offering a comprehensive range of services, including robotic surgery, oncology, cardiology, nephrology, neurology, neurosurgery, urology, gastroenterology, interventional radiology, and transplant facilities. With a strong focus on research and quality education, we remain dedicated to innovation and compassionate healthcare and community well-being.

items.label: Teaching–Learning Facilities
items.content: Air-conditioned lecture theatres with audio-visual aids and live procedure broadcasts, Largest tertiary care hospital with attached super-specialty centre.

items.label: Teaching Learning Methodologies
items.content: Dedicated AETCOM sessions, Structured self-directed learning (SSDL) modules, Flipped classrooms, Integrated modules, Family Adoption Program, Induction programs, Get Set Go, PG training facilities including advanced modular OTs, Skill training sessions. Teachers training programme for capacity building by Medical Education Unit and NMC Nodal Centre for Faculty development.

items.label: Technology-Enabled Digital Learning
items.content: LMS with resource sharing, quizzes, assignments.

items.label: Laboratory & Hospital Facilities
items.content: Histology, Haematology, Histopathology, Biochemistry, Microbiology labs, OSPE/OSCE ward for skill training & assessment, CRL with high-end equipment and integrated research.

items.label: Advanced Teaching, Museum & Skilllab
items.content: “Jigyasa” digital museum (15,000+ sq. ft.), QR-coded, self-learning hub, “Anukriti” Simulation Centre with high-fidelity mannequins, AHA & National Board accreditation, Mayo Clinic-backed Standardized Patient Program (SPP), Cadaveric skill lab with soft-embalmed specimens, Wet lab for basic to advanced surgical skills.

items.label: Library Facilities
items.content: Fully air-conditioned central resource, Books, journals for all departments, Subscriptions: Access Medicine, UpToDate, Royal Society of Medicine, BMJ, Digital library with 100+ computers and Wi-Fi.

data.heading: MEDICAL EDUCATION UNIT, JNMC, WARDHA
paragraphs: The Medical Education Unit (MEU) at Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Wardha, is the in-house body of faculty representatives from Pre-Clinical, Para-Clinical and Clinical subjects, who plays a pivotal role in ensuring the quality of medical education by focusing on implementation, monitoring and evaluation of faculty training, curriculum revision, development of learning resource material, innovation in instructional tools and assessment.

The MEU aims to equip medical educators with advanced teaching methodologies and pedagogical skills, ensuring the delivery of effective and contemporary medical education, a standardized approach to medical education across institutions and continuous improvement of educational practices and policies within the institution.

data.heading: Innovative, Learner-Centric Teaching Methodologies
data.subheading: Nurturing critical thinkers and compassionate clinicians

cards.description: Simulated Learning with mannequin and task stations, Anatomage, Lap mentors, BLS & ACLS by American Heart Association
Integrated teaching, Early clinical exposure, Inter-department Case discussions, Clinico-pathologic conference, OSPE-OSCE
Research opportunities for all learners, ICMR STS, Innovation cell, Biomedical Engineering and Technology Innovation Centre (BETIC), E-YUVA Fellowship under BIRAC
Standardised Patient Program (SPP) Case-based learning (Master Clinic) in collaboration with Weill Cornell Medicine, USA
Bioethics Unit under International Chair in Bioethics, AETCOM, Get Set Go
Mentoring by national and international Adjunct Faculty

data.heading: RESEARCH & COLLABORATIONS
intro_paragraphs: Driven by a team of highly qualified and experienced faculty, JNMC upholds a rich legacy of teaching excellence and a strong track record of research contributions.
Faculty have published extensively in prestigious journals, including The Lancet, BMJ, Frontiers, Nature, and more.
Three faculties are in the list of the world’s top 2% scientists released by Stanford University (Elsevier’s Scopus database).
The institution’s contributions include books, copyrights, and patents advancing medical science.

data.heading: Global Opportunities
data.description: JNMC empowers students to become globally competent healthcare leaders through partnerships with institutions like, Weill Cornell Medicine (USA), Johns Hopkins University (USA), University of Sydney (Australia), Kazan University (Russia), Caribbean School of Medicine, and Ross University. Opportunities include international conferences, student exchange programs, clinical immersions at Cleveland Clinic (Abu Dhabi) and Imperial College (UK), and participation in global signature courses like the Standardized Patient Program and case-based Master Clinics (Weill Cornell). These experiences equip students with world-class medical knowledge, cross-cultural competence, and lifelong global networks.
